trans-unit.source: This tutorial is built on the <link><linkText>GetStartedWithMobileServices app</linkText><title></title></link>, which is a universal Windows app project in Visual Studio 2013.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial is built on the <link><linkText>GetStartedWithMobileServices app</linkText><title></title></link>, which is a universal Windows app project in Visual Studio 2013.

trans-unit.source: The UI for this app is identical to the app generated by the Mobile Services quickstart, except that added items are stored locally in memory.
trans-unit.target: The UI for this app is identical to the app generated by the Mobile Services quickstart, except that added items are stored locally in memory.

trans-unit.source: Download the JavaScript version of the GetStartedWithMobileServices sample app from the [Developer Code Samples site].
trans-unit.target: Download the JavaScript version of the GetStartedWithMobileServices sample app from the [Developer Code Samples site].

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio 2013, open the downloaded project, expand the js folder in Solution Explorer, and examine the default.js file.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio 2013, open the downloaded project, expand the js folder in Solution Explorer, and examine the default.js file.

trans-unit.source: Notice that added TodoItem objects are stored in an in-memory WinJS.Binding.List.
trans-unit.target: Notice that added TodoItem objects are stored in an in-memory WinJS.Binding.List.

trans-unit.source: Press the F5 key to rebuild the project and start the app.
trans-unit.target: Press the F5 key to rebuild the project and start the app.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type some text in Insert a TodoItem, then click Save.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type some text in Insert a TodoItem, then click Save.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the saved text is displayed.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the saved text is displayed.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the Windows Phone 8.1 project, click Set as Start-up Project, then press F5 to start the Windows Phone Store app.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the Windows Phone 8.1 project, click Set as Start-up Project, then press F5 to start the Windows Phone Store app.

trans-unit.source: Repeat steps 3 and 4 to verify that the sample behaves the same way.
trans-unit.target: Repeat steps 3 and 4 to verify that the sample behaves the same way.
